name: 11.1 "The Little Match Girl" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 11 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was smoking in Sam's office?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	She was in there contemplating life. She then told Sam that that cigarette was the last one she'd ever smoke.

questions.text: What happened when Rebecca threw her cigarette out?
questions.correct: She burned down part of the bar.
options: She was told by Sam not to put it in the garbage can.
She made sure the cigarette was fully snuffed out.
She changed her mind and started to smoke it again.
questions.explanation:
She burned down part of the bar.

	Right as she left the office you saw the flames come out of the waste basket. The next shot you saw were the firemen in what's left of the bar.

questions.text: What did Sam think happened at first?
questions.correct: That it was another trick from Gary
options: That he burned down his own bar
questions.explanation:
That it was another trick from Gary.

	Sam was looking around and then started to laugh. He told Gary it was time to hit the switch and make everything go back together.

questions.text: Who took what happened to the bar the worst?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	He kept crying and saying, "Oh the humanity." He then went over to Gary's for the next few days.

questions.text: Why was Cliff upset about what happened?
questions.correct: He left undelivered mail at the bar.
options: He just felt really bad for Sam.
questions.explanation:
He left undelivered mail at the bar.

	He asked Norm if they could finish delivering it around 2am the night before. Norm said "no", so Cliff just left it at the bar saying he'd deliver it tomorrow.

questions.text: Who figured out whose fault what happened was?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	He heard the fire marshal say what the cause was and then saw Rebecca start to hyperventilate.  She asked Frasier to tell Sam he did it.

questions.text: Did Rebecca tell Sam the truth at first?
questions.explanation:
No.

	She told him that the bar burned down because of faulty wiring. Sam then blamed himself for the fire.

questions.text: Why didn't Norm stay at Gary's Olde Towne Tavern?
questions.correct: Gary wouldn't run him a tab.
options: He came back to help clean up.
Gary said Cheers folk weren't welcome.
questions.explanation:
Gary wouldn't run him a tab.

	This is a disconnection from a previous episode where Norm stated that he had a bar tab at Gary's. Norm said, Gary "was a real jerk about it too".

questions.text: Sam was thinking of selling his corvette. Who did he say had his eye on it?
questions.explanation:
Kirby.

	Kirby was Sam's neighbor. Sam was trying to figure out how he could rebuild Cheers when the banks wouldn't give him a loan.

questions.text: How did Sam respond to Rebecca's news that it was her fault at first?
questions.correct: He yelled at her and then kicked her out of the bar.
options: He accepted her apology and gave her a hug.
questions.explanation:
He yelled at her and then kicked her out of the bar.

	Later on, Rebecca came back and offered Sam her life savings to help fix the bar. Sam went to say something and she said, "What I did was terrible, but what you did was worse because you did it on purpose?" Sam ended up rehiring Rebecca because when he first came back to Cheers after his boat sunk, she gave him a job - so now they were even.
